alert.note: Alert for New London (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 12:21AM EST until January 11 at 11:48PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Connecticut... Quinebaug River near Jewett City affecting New London County. For the Quinebaug...including Jewett City...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Quinebaug River near Jewett City. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, Norman Road and banjo Sullivan Road are closed with water covering the roadway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 18.3 feet. - The river was near crest at 18.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 PM EST Wednesday was 18.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.5 feet early this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 17.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.4 feet on 01/25/1979. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Quinebaug River Jewett City 17.5 18.3 Wed 11 pm ES 15.0 12.0 MSG &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1230 PM EST.
